candidates.title: Add IQEngine
candidates.body:
This PR adds to maia-httpd and maia-wasm the changes required to add IQEngine as a viewer for the IQ recording stored on the Pluto DDR.

The way in which this works is by implementing some of the IQEngine backend API methods in maia-httpd. The IQEngine client is compressed using lz4 to save ramfs space and served by maia-httpd. When the IQEngine client is fetched by the web browser, it starts talking to maia-httpd believing that it is a regular IQEngine backend. The IQEngine API methods in maia-httpd return IQ samples / metadata corresponding to the recording done to the DDR by Maia SDR.

Previously each request to get IQ data from the recording involved `mmap()`ing the recording and performing cache invalidation of the whole recording. This is not a good approach for IQEngine, because it performs many separate queries to get pieces of IQ data, and invalidating the cache is time consuming. `mmap()`ing a large file is also time consuming, since it involves creating page tables. Instead, a shared "global" `mmap()` is held by the application, and this is used to serve all the queries. When a new recording is done, the old `mmap()` is unmapped and a new `mmap()` is done. This invalidates the cache. The "global" `mmap()` is managed with a `RwLock`, which prevents getting IQ data while a recording is in progress or starting a recording while IQ data is being retrieved.

candidates.title: maia-httpd: bump axum to v0.7
candidates.body: This requires a few code changes due a major version change in axum.

candidates.title: maia-httpd: regenerate maia-pac with svd2rust v0.31
candidates.body: Code generated with svd2rust v0.31 includes some API changes that require changes in maia-httpd. Registers are now accessed using methods instead of struct fields.

candidates.title: maia-httpd,maia-wasm: optimize code generation
candidates.body: Use codegen-units=1 in maia-httpd and maia-wasm. Use CPU flags for the Zynq Cortex A9 in maia-httpd.

candidates.title: Release v0.6.0
candidates.body: This contains the Cargo.lock and changelog updates for the release.

candidates.title: Add spectrometer peak detect mode
candidates.body:
This adds a peak detect mode to the spectrometer as described in #10. A new power average / peak detect implementation using one DSP48 at 3x clock instead of two DSP48 at 1x clock has been added to maia-hdl. The average / peak detect mode is exposed in on register. The required changes to support setting this parameter have been added to maia-json, maia-httpd and maia-wasm.

Here is a demo of how the peak detect mode and the UI element looks like. This is the 1090 MHz aeronautical band, where there is ADS-B and DME signals, which are all pulsed. The spectrometer is first running on average mode (top part), and then is changed to peak detect.

![peak_detect_screenshot](https://github.com/maia-sdr/maia-sdr/assets/15093841/3901297b-b282-47b2-9305-10ccde1e51ed)

Note that the DME and ADS-B signals are much more visible in peak detect mode. There is also another change, which is that the noise floor is higher. Normalization to make changes between average and peak detect look well is tricky. Currently, the normalization is that average corresponds to average power within each integration, and peak corresponds to maximum power within each integration. A signal that has constant envelope will be displayed with the same power (and same colour in the waterfall) in both modes. However, noise, and many other kinds of signals get high measurements for peak than for average.

(This closes #10)

candidates.title: Fix SigMF core:datetime formatting and release
candidates.body: This introduces a commit to fix the SigMF `core:datetime` formatting in maia-httpd, updates the dependencies of all the Rust crates, and bumps a new release version.

candidates.title: Update Rust dependencies
candidates.body: Update dependencies of `maia-httpd` and `maia-wasm` and bump the versions of these crates.

candidates.title: bump to v0.2.0
candidates.body: Update the CHANGELOGs of the components, as well as the Cargo.lock's

candidates.title: add CHANGELOGs and bump some versions
candidates.body: Bump maia-httpd to v0.1.1 because of minor changes and maia-wasm to v0.2.0 because of API-breaking changes.

candidates.title: maia-httpd: do not use chrono default features
candidates.body:
This eliminates a dependency on time >= 0.1, < 0.2, which has a security problem, as reported by dependabot.
(See https://github.com/maia-sdr/maia-sdr/security/dependabot/1).

candidates.title: maia-wasm: add example of standalone waterfall
candidates.body: Inspired by the [experiment](https://github.com/bastibl/maia-sdr/commit/ec0a2ca873232ae080a70059dc85434219814443) done by @bastibl about using the WebGL2 waterfall in FutureSDR, I have refactored part of the maia-wasm `lib.rs` to improve the reusability of the waterfall and added a crate with an example that shows how to use the waterfall in a standalone way. This example reads the waterfall data from a JPEG file embedded in the wasm file. The example will also be showed as a demo in the Maia SDR webpage.

repo.name: maia-sdr
repo.description: Maia SDR is an open-source FPGA-based SDR project focusing on the ADALM Pluto
